text: Kenny McFadden (1960/1961 â€“ March 2022) was an American professional basketball player. He played and coached in New Zealand. McFadden played for Washington State University under coach George Raveling. McFadden moved to New Zealand in 1982 and joined the Wellington Saints. He won four championships during the 1980s. He retired in 1996. McFadden died in March 2022 from kidney disease, aged 61. ==References== Category:1960s births Category:2022 deaths Category:Deaths from kidney disease Category:American basketball players Category:New Zealand sportspeople Category:College basketball coaches
title: Kenny McFadden
